title: I'm not waiting more than 2 patches for tanks to get buffed.
body:
I've said it before and I'll say it again. 
I've seen how long it can take to alter champions after their class updates, and I don't want my champion to be left alone for 5+ patches because "we need to wait and see if buffs are in order". 

Buffs **_ARE_** in order for any champion affected by the sunfire change, and I don't care if it's as simple as + 10 base damage, + 50 range, + 10 base armour, we need something.

The community comes up with decent ideas sometimes, try some of those! 
PLEASE, don't leave us in the dust of Sejuani and maokai.

I think what some people are focusing on is the confusion of when tanks are supposed to be good.  In early game they haven't become that tanky yet or have their items which help them do their job.  In mid game they get pushed out by Black Cleaver builders in both jungle and top and sometimes the ADC.  In late game all ADC's build some combination of Lord Dominiks or Mortal Reminder and you can add Blade of the Ruined King of that mix.

This is not including champions who come with true damage built in, particularly some of the popular ADC's such as Twitch, Varus, Kog'maw and Vayne.

Stacking HP was the one thing that allowed tanks to still tank, that's all been reduced and Sunfire/Cinder is worse.  So, it's left tanks in kind of a weird spot where they aren't supposed to do much damage, but can't tank properly anymore either.  We see this in reverse with bruisers who get to have the fun with all the tank items, but still get their damage as well, because they always benefit the most from new changes on either side of the spectrum.  I think most of us assumed HP was the tank stat, as crit is to ADC and lethality to assassins.

IMO tanks as a whole actually are a strong class, but this newest shake up in combination with the meta is causing some problems with how they are supposed to function.  The balancing act of figuring out how to make tanks "tankier" without affecting who else can have it must be a very tricky road indeed.

Because this game has been and always will be one of damage.

How do you take objectives?  You fucking do damage to them.

How do you get gold?  Well, you're a support, or you fucking  do damage to creeps and monsters.

How do you win the game?  You do 5k damage to the nexus.

How do you force your laner back, or kill them?  Guess fucking what?  You do damage to them. 

***EVERY*** source of solo gold beyond passive generation is from doing damage.  Period.  The end. If you want items, which you need, *especially* as a tank-- you need HP, both resists, some CDR, and usually some form of sustain/regen, well, guess what?  All of those items cost gold, and as such, you need to do damage to get them.

Tanks no longer have the minimum damage required to adequately survive solo lanes to get get the gold they need to then adequately survive teamfights.  Tanks need more gold, to get this gold, they need to do more damage.   

All the ADC's would bitch, whine, and moan if we just gave the stats purchased from items to tanks outright ("muh statstticks* -while conveniently being the single most stat stick based class who literally wins almost purely because their damage formula is multiplicative and they get so much more power and gold efficiency out of their stats than any other class in the game bar none.) so, tanks need more damage in laning.

In teamfights? I dont want that to change. But in laning phase you will either have damage or lose the lane. Damage is required for laning and ANY kind of interaction with the opponent. Whats the point of you not dying while you get 0 farm or have to back every minute because the enemy pushes you out but you cant?

That's a pretty massive overgeneralisation. Sure some tanks are mana hungry, some don't even have mana.

Shen and Zac would obviously be the two top examples of tanks with literally 0 use for mana, but there's also other tanks with bellow average mana costs who can get away with low or no mana in their builds like Sion and Poppy if for some reason you decide against a Sheen on her.

I also think D-Shield will be pretty core on tanks into more aggressive matchups. The amount of HP it gives with its regen is utterly giant and if you play safe it's enough to regen of sporadic harass from even some of the strongest laners in the meta for a long time. Plus the extra 5 damage VS creeps is great for CSing when you really can't spend an extra AAs duration in a creepwave as is the case VS aggro lanes.

First, if you are Sion and have to use abilities to clear waves you will go oom and you can't harass.  Poppy already has shit wave clear even if she spams q.  Melee fighters fighters can just buy tiamat.  Doran's shield is solid but still better for fighters that actually melee a lot.

The waveclear and fighting strength that is no longer available on sunfire hurt most tanks.  Then you add the fact that other melee ADs and carries got item buffs and this is what happens.

Essentially mana isn't really the issue.  It's that tanks in general now lack wave clear and enough strength early to be effective in lane.  The itemization changes didn't do them any favors.  And now more than ever you can't afford to run too many tank items with zero health.  And there are actually more of those now but you can only afford to buy 2 at most really.

Tanks can also rush Titanic Hydra to clear waves, infact if Riot goes in the direction of buffing tanks rather than tank items this will almost certainly be optimal, even more so if some of those buffs go into HP. This is especially true when we talk about Poppy and Sion who already have low mana costs and special synergies with the item, Sion having good DPS with it after death and Poppy being able to ranged proc it.

I think people have got too caught up assuming tanks have to stick to tank items, if Sunfire's a shitty item you can't use look to other waveclear options, Titanic is very good on certain tanks, I'd say Sej, Sion, Poppy, Shen, Malphite and maybe Kench top or Naut if you're not going for a Stoneplate would be solid users.

On other tanks you probably want to look at AP options for waveclear for the most part though. There's certainly tanks like Maokai and Zac who have no place at all using Hydra.

Titanic is pointless for many of those AD tanks.  They don't auto enough.  It is sub optimal on tanks like Sion and Poppy.  They are better served going iceborn guantlet and steraks honestly.  They also need CDR early.  And banking on using Sion's passive is the dumbest thing ever.  

They can build Titanic and it's okay but it's not a great item for them.  It's also expensive and they can't just sit on the Tiamat really.  They don't use it as well as say Renekton, J4, Shen, and others.  Bottom line is it's not near as good as sunfire was.
